intro: Elatostema arcuatipes, commonly known as the curved-leaved elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly in countries like India and China. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Elatostema arcuatipes is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
